content: It is no use walking anywhere to preach unless our walking is our preaching.
author: Francis of Assisi

content: The shortest distance between a problem and a solution is the distance between your knees and the floor
author: Charles Stanley

content: If the Holy Spirit guides us, He will do it according to the Scriptures and never contrary to them.
author: George Muller

content: We must all have the spirit of martyrdom, though we may not all die martyrs.
author: George Whitefield

content: In our prayers, we talk to God, in our Bible study, God talks to us, and we had better let God do most of the talking.
author: D.L. Moody

content: I desire to have both heaven and hell ever in my eye, while I stand on this isthmus of life, between two boundless oceans.
author: John Wesley

content: Preach the gospel to yourself every day.
author: Jerry Bridges

content: Jesus’ mission is not to make converts, and it never has been. His mission is to make disciples.
author: Jim Putnam

content: We have got to make disciples. Fun nights and pizza nights are not going to sustain us.
author: Francis Chan

content: What one generation tolerates, the next generation will embrace.
author: John Wesley

content: The man who does not know the nature of the Law, cannot know the nature of sin.
author: John Bunyan

content: All originality and no plagiarism makes for dull preaching.
author: Charles Spurgeon

content: It is the duty of every Christian to be Christ to his neighbor.
author: Martin Luther

content: The greatest proof that the Bible is inspired is that it has stood so much bad preaching.
author: A.T. Robertson

content: Any church that is not seriously involved in helping fulfill the Great Commission has forfeited its biblical right to exist.
author: Oswald J. Smith

content: We talk of the Second Coming; half the world has never heard of the first.
author: Oswald J. Smith

content: If you’re walking with Jesus, in the Spirit, you need not fear going too far. No believer has gone as far as God wants him to go.
author: A.A. Allen

content: Revival is when God gets so sick and tired of being misrepresented that He shows Himself.
author: Leonard Ravenhill

content: Catch on fire with enthusiasm and people will come for miles to watch you burn.
author: John Wesley

content: God uses men who are weak and feeble enough to lean on him.
author: Hudson Taylor

content: The man who will present Christ to others must be occupied with Christ for Himself.
author: C.H. Mackintosh

content: The Christian life is not slightly better, but completely different.
author: Clarence Sexton

content: Someday, when in the presence of our Savior, we will thank Him for every burden, every trial, and every heartache.
author: J. Vernon McGee

content: Christ went more willingly to the cross than we do to the throne of grace.
author: Thomas Watson

content: Life is wasted if we do not grasp the glory of the cross, cherish it for the treasure that it is, and cleave to it as the highest price of every pleasure and the deepest comfort in every pain. What was once foolishness to us—a crucified God—must become our wisdom and our power and our only boast in this world.
author: John Piper

content: God never said that the journey would be easy, but He did say that the arrival would be worthwhile
author: Max Lucado

content: God’s work done in God’s way will never lack God’s supplies.
author: Hudson Taylor

content: Remember who you are. Don’t compromise for anyone, for any reason. You are a child of the Almighty God. Live that truth.
author: Lysa Terkeurst

content: Let God’s promises shine on your problems.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

content: God will meet you where you are in order to take you where He wants you to go.
author: Tony Evans

content: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows; it empties today of its strength.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

content: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
author: Chuck Swindoll

content: The Christian life is not a constant high. I have my moments of deep discouragement. I have to go to God in prayer with tears in my eyes, and say, 'O God, forgive me,' or 'Help me.'
author: Billy Graham

content: This is our time on the history line of God. This is it. What will we do with the one deep exhale of God on this earth? For we are but a vapor and we have to make it count. We’re on. Direct us, Lord, and get us on our feet.
author: Beth Moore

content: The greater your knowledge of the goodness and grace of God on your life, the more likely you are to praise Him in the storm.
author: Matt Chandler

content: God is able to take the mess of our past and turn it into a message. He takes the trials and tests and turns them into a testimony.
author: Christine Caine

content: The best and most beautiful things in this world cannot be seen or even heard, but must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

content: Always, everywhere God is present, and always He seeks to discover Himself to each one.
author: A.W.Tozer

content: The best thing about the future is that it comes only one day at a time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Continuous effort -- not strength nor intelligence -- is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

content: We can see hope in the midst of hopelessness. We can see peace in the midst of chaos. We have a hope that the world does not have. We can see clearly that all things work together for the good of them that love Him and are called according to His purpose.
author: Priscilla Shirer

content: There is not a single thing that Jesus cannot change, control, and conquer because he is the living Lord.
author: Franklin Graham

content: Forgive me for being so ordinary while claiming to know so extraordinary a God.
author: Jim Elliot

content: Faith never knows where it is being led, but it loves and knows the One who is leading.
author: Oswald Chambers

content: The most difficult lie I have ever contended with is this: life is a story about me.
author: Donald Miller

content: The world needs Christians who don’t tolerate the complacency of their own lives.
author: Francis Chan

content: Christ’s death is the Christian’s life. Christ’s cross is the Christian’s title to heaven.
author: J.C. Ryle

content: It is sweet to be nothing and less than nothing that Christ may be all in all.
author: David Brainerd

content: Prayer is not overcoming God’s reluctance, but laying hold of His willingness.
author: Martin Luther

content: Faith goes up the stairs that love has built and looks out the windows which hope has opened.
author: Charles Spurgeon
